alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Ynez Mountains Eastern Range; Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 9:09AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SANTA BARBARA COUNTY THROUGH 945 AM PST... At 908 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms approaching southern Santa Barbara County from the Pacific Coastal Waters. Movement of this activity was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Santa Barbara... Montecito... Carpinteria... Summerland... Isla Vista... Goleta... Hope Ranch... Santa Barbara Air[port... and Mission Canyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to flash flooding. A Flash Flood Warning is in effect. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
